intro: Hedycarya australasica, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant is typically found in humid, shaded environments, such as forests and rocky outcrops. Its rhizome system allows it to anchor firmly in soil, while its fronds can reach lengths of up to 5 meters. Hedycarya australasica plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various native wildlife species.
